snippet.textDisplay: I really liked this game, despite the hate it got
snippet.textOriginal: I really liked this game, despite the hate it got

snippet.textDisplay: My favorite handheld and cel-shaded Zelda game. There was a lot of charm in ST, the dungeons were more inventive than the previous few iterations in the series, riding around in a train was a blast for me (purely subjective, I realize many people don't care for that aspect but whatever, I love trains!), and I really liked the friendship between Link and Zelda here (which paved the way for the romantic relationship in SS - not a coincidence, since it's the same writers behind both games).
snippet.textOriginal: My favorite handheld and cel-shaded Zelda game. There was a lot of charm in ST, the dungeons were more inventive than the previous few iterations in the series, riding around in a train was a blast for me (purely subjective, I realize many people don't care for that aspect but whatever, I love trains!), and I really liked the friendship between Link and Zelda here (which paved the way for the romantic relationship in SS - not a coincidence, since it's the same writers behind both games).

snippet.textDisplay:
While i don't agree that it's the best game in the franchise (i personally give that honor to Majora's Mask), i will say that it has the best incarnation of Zelda, and it's got really fun puzzles and great music.

Plus those weird creepy sand monsters. It also has those.
snippet.textOriginal:
While i don't agree that it's the best game in the franchise (i personally give that honor to Majora's Mask), i will say that it has the best incarnation of Zelda, and it's got really fun puzzles and great music.

Plus those weird creepy sand monsters. It also has those.

snippet.textDisplay: @nonten4 I know that your comment was over a year ago, but I still think that people didn't give the DS Zelda games enough credit. Sure, the controls were strange, but they worked, and they were fun when you got used to them. The games themselves still hold up today as great top-down Zelda games, imo.
snippet.textOriginal: @nonten4 I know that your comment was over a year ago, but I still think that people didn't give the DS Zelda games enough credit. Sure, the controls were strange, but they worked, and they were fun when you got used to them. The games themselves still hold up today as great top-down Zelda games, imo.

snippet.textDisplay: I probably wouldn't like the DS games that much, but after playing Twilight Princess which I thought was by far the worse Zelda ever the DS games seemed alright to me. Then Skyward Sword came out and suddenly I don't think it's that bad any more. I'd be pretty surprised if Nintendo could make a Zelda worse then SS, but that's what I said about twilight princess, so it is very possible.
snippet.textOriginal: I probably wouldn't like the DS games that much, but after playing Twilight Princess which I thought was by far the worse Zelda ever the DS games seemed alright to me. Then Skyward Sword came out and suddenly I don't think it's that bad any more. I'd be pretty surprised if Nintendo could make a Zelda worse then SS, but that's what I said about twilight princess, so it is very possible.

snippet.textDisplay: I loved both Phantom Hourglass and Spirit Tracks. ST is in my top 5 Zelda games, and PH is towards the bottom of my list...but not the worst. I think both are underrated games.

snippet.textDisplay:
Phantom Hourglass is the only Zelda game I haven't finished. That sea god temple is so repetitive and - ugh! It's a horrible concept, badly implemented. I was horrified to see it make its way into a game like Zelda.

I like Spirit Tracks because I used to want to be a train conductor, and it had a fantastic soundtrack.
snippet.textOriginal:
Phantom Hourglass is the only Zelda game I haven't finished. That sea god temple is so repetitive and - ugh! It's a horrible concept, badly implemented. I was horrified to see it make its way into a game like Zelda.

I like Spirit Tracks because I used to want to be a train conductor, and it had a fantastic soundtrack.

snippet.textDisplay:
I thought that PH was amazing...100% completion, all the gems, all the dungeons, the spin ability...

and I even played the darn arrow mini game hundreds of times over and turned my DS on occasionally to check for new ship pieces just to collect them all.

I think that I finally got the golden hull just  a month ago. I was incredibly happy.

You guys really didn't like PH? I thought it was amazing...

snippet.textDisplay: An improvement over PH, but I have to say the 2 DS Zelda games are my least favorite in the series. I find the music in general pretty lackluster (especially PH), the controls simply make me wish I could play with a normal d-pad and the dungeons are mostly boring. There's just something about the layout, everything seems too symetrical and artificial compared to other games in the series.
snippet.textOriginal: An improvement over PH, but I have to say the 2 DS Zelda games are my least favorite in the series. I find the music in general pretty lackluster (especially PH), the controls simply make me wish I could play with a normal d-pad and the dungeons are mostly boring. There's just something about the layout, everything seems too symetrical and artificial compared to other games in the series.
